abstract: Greylock Partners, which has backed Facebook and LinkedIn, announced Monday that it had put together a new $575 million fund, one of the biggest to be created in the last year.
snippet: Greylock Partners, which has backed Facebook and LinkedIn, announced Monday that it had put together a new $575 million fund, one of the biggest to be created in the last year.
lead_paragraph: Even amid the contraction of the venture capital industry, which fertilizes the seeds of new technology start-ups, some firms are expanding, The New York Times’s Claire Cain Miller reports.
